The plant produces yellow flowers in globular or cylindrical clusters, which are followed by flat, pod-like fruits. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
